page.title: 02NETHER HEYFORD VILLAGE HALL
page.content:
The Village Hall was 25 years old in 1985. The idea of building a Hall was first considered in 1935. By 1956 the funds stood at less than 900 pounds but the estimated cost of building a hall was 4000 pounds. At a public meeting the idea of using voluntary labour came up, this gave the committee food for thought. It was agreed that this was the only answer and so further fund raising was undertaken.
The Hall was completed at a cost of 2,900 pounds but the insurance value was 4000 pounds. All that and not a penny paid in wages! Now built, yards of curtains had to be sewn and crockery & cutlery bought before it could be opened. It was officially opened in 1960 by the then Viscount Althorp, now the Earl Spencer, Prince Charles' father-in-law.
